title: Okay, I'm taking a break.
body: So, I have made a few champion concepts in the past few months and I have many more ideas. The concepts I have released were entered in competitions which gave me some really helpful feedback. One constant problem I keep getting is the kit. I feel like I do not know the game mechanics as well as I need to to make champion concepts. After all, I am only level 20. So, until I know the game well enough I will not be posting any more champion concepts.

replies.body: This is an unfortunate thing to hear, but if you believe you're going to come back stronger, do whatever it takes. If you ever need a second opinion on something, feel free to ask. I know a second opinion often helps in the design process.

> [{quoted}](name=Nopatik,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=zh9BIZHT,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-05-01T22:02:19.690+0000)

> So, I have made a few champion concepts in the past few months and I have many more ideas. The concepts I have released were entered in competitions which gave me some really helpful feedback. One constant problem I keep getting is the kit. I feel like I do not know the game mechanics as well as I need to to make champion concepts. After all, I am only level 20. So, until I know the game well enough I will not be posting any more champion concepts.

Understandable. I didn't understand abilities and kits fully until I started checking out the LoL wiki and getting more of a feel as to what's healthy to include in a champion concept. Good luck in the future, man!

Glad to hear you're back in the game, its gonna be interesting I bet >:]

May the odds be ever in your favor~

Thank you all for your feedback.  After rethinking it, I have decided to continue creating concepts. I will ask my brother for help with kits, he has put over 1,400 hours into the game and knows it better than anyone I know. Don't worry, the ability ideas will still be mine, but he will just help with balancing the stats of the champion.

I've logged about 5,000 hours into this game, play ranked, hang onto every word uttered at the analysts' desk, and am a professional game designer, and yet I still struggle with kits constantly.

Keep going, read everything you can, find something that inspires you and get back at it ASAP.  You'll never truly feel ready, so there's no point in waiting until you do.
